title: UPDATE 1-Charles Taylor warns on FY profit
author: Reuters Staff
description: * Says adjusting services division performed below its view
text:
* Says adjusting services division performed below its view
* Says non-life interests expected to post better profit
(Adds details)
Jan 28 (Reuters) - Insurance consultancy Charles Taylor Consulting Plc
[CHAT.L](/companies/CHAT.L) said it sees full-year adjusted pretax profit lower than previously expected, partially hurt by its adjusting-services business.
Charles Taylor had said on Nov. 16 that it expects earnings for the full-year towards the lower end of its view.
The company’s adjusting-services division -- which provides advice to insurers and shipowners -- was slightly weaker-than-expected, hurt by lower level of activity before the year-end, the company said in a statement.
The company derives nearly 50 percent of its revenue from its adjusting services division.
However, the company’s non-life insurance interest, which is part of its larger insurance support services division, is expected to post better-than-expected post-tax results.
Charles Taylor’s shares, which have shed 16 percent since Nov. 16, closed at 153 pence on Thursday on the London Stock Exchange.
